text: Helcystogramma arulensis is a moth in the family Gelechiidae. It was described by Rebel in 1929. It is found in Italy, Switzerland, Austria, Hungary, the Czech Republic, Slovakia, Romania, Ukraine and Russia.Fauna Europaea The wingspan is 13–14 mm. The forewings are dark brown, the veins broadly suffused with blackish scales and with a dot at the end of the cell. The hindwings are somewhat darker, with a blackish line.Rebel, H. (1929): Versammlung am 5. April 1929. — Verhandlungen der zoologisch-botanischen Gesellschaft in Wien 79: (48)-(53) ==References== Category:Moths described in 1929 arulensis Category:Moths of Europe Category:Moths of Russia
title: Helcystogramma arulensis
